alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued November 10 at 3:52PM EST until November 12 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SATURDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM TO 11 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves up to 7 feet in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected along shorelines and tidal waterways (6.9 to 7.1 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 1 AM EST Saturday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 PM to 11 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...This could result in some roads becoming impassable. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 9:11 PM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 1 to 2 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 10/09 PM 7.0 1.2 1.9 N/A Minor 11/09 AM 6.9 1.1 0.9 N/A None 11/10 PM 5.0 -0.8 0.1 N/A None 12/10 AM 5.4 -0.4 -0.5 N/A None 12/11 PM 4.3 -1.5 -0.4 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
